intro: Grammosolen odgersii subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its low, spreading growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and inland deserts. This subspecies is adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy plant in xeriscaped landscapes.
